result.execSummary:
The defendant William A. Daiker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or any time he does not meet that requirement defendant must perform 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with Fleet Farm in Wausau.

Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
If successfully completes probation he may petition for expungement.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 16CM90 and 16CM91 called: 11:01am
State appears by ADA C.Minder. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Abernethy Mays.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to :
16CM91>>D&RI entire file
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
16CM90 - Ct. 1 (Retail Theft)>>NO CONTEST
16CM90 - Ct. 2 (Retail Theft)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held on each count; 1 year probation on each count, concurrent.
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; N/C with Fleet Farm in Wausau; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or any time he does not meet that requirement, defendant must perform 10 hours of C.S. per week; CC; DNA sample and surcharge.

>>If defendant successfully completes probation, he may petition COURT for expungement.

Adj: 11:07am

Pre-trial conference at 02-23-2016 09:10 am.
Plea hearing at 03-07-2016 11:00 am.
Final pre-trial at 04-14-2016 09:00 am.
Jury Trial at 05-03-2016 09:00 am.
Defendant wants atty; sent to PD office; new PTC set

Includes 16CM90 and 16CM91.  No contact with victim(s):  Fleet Farm/Wausau or D.J.R.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.
